title: Southern Pecan Pie II
description: Experience the rich, buttery goodness of this classic Southern pecan pie, a treasured recipe passed down through generations. With its flaky crust and luscious, nutty filling, this pie is perfect for cozy dinners or festive gatherings.
ingredients: ½ cup butter, chilled and diced
instructions: In a large bowl, combine 1 ½ cups flour, 3 tablespoons sugar, and salt.
Cut in the chilled, diced butter until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs.
Mix the egg yolk with ice water and stir into the flour mixture until it forms a ball.
Wrap the dough in plastic wrap and refrigerate for 1 hour or overnight.
Roll out the dough and place it in a 9-inch pie plate.
Preheat oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C).
Place pecan halves evenly in the bottom of the pie crust.
In a large bowl, stir together ¾ cup sugar and 2 tablespoons flour.
Add eggs, corn syrup, milk, melted butter, and vanilla extract; blend well.
Pour the filling over the pecans in the crust.
Bake in the preheated oven for 10 minutes.
Reduce oven temperature to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) and bake for 40 to 50 minutes, or until golden brown and the filling is set.
Allow the pie to cool completely before serving to let the filling firm up.
tips: Use chilled butter and ice water for a flaky crust. Don’t overmix the dough to keep it tender. Bake until the filling is just set to avoid a runny center. Let the pie cool fully to achieve perfect slicing.

structured_content.content: This Southern Pecan Pie II is a timeless dessert that delights with its golden, flaky crust and rich, gooey pecan filling. The aroma of toasted pecans and vanilla fills your kitchen, making it a truly special treat for any occasion.

structured_content.content: I first tasted this pie at a family reunion, where its warm, comforting flavors instantly brought everyone together. Sharing this recipe from my dear friend Joyce connects me to Southern traditions and cherished memories.

• Main ingredient: Fresh pecan halves provide a crunchy texture and deep nutty flavor essential for an authentic pecan pie.
  • Key seasonings/flavoring agents: Vanilla extract enhances the sweetness and adds aromatic depth; light corn syrup creates the signature glossy, smooth filling.
  • Supporting ingredients: Butter and eggs enrich the filling and crust, while flour stabilizes the pie’s structure.
  • Equipment needed: Mixing bowls, pie plate, rolling pin, and an oven capable of precise temperature control.

Preparation:
Combine dry ingredients and cut in chilled butter until crumbly. Add egg yolk mixed with ice water to form dough. Chill dough for at least 1 hour to ensure a flaky crust.
Cooking/Baking Process:
Roll out dough and line pie plate. Arrange pecans evenly. Mix filling ingredients thoroughly and pour over pecans. Bake first at high heat to set crust, then lower temperature to cook filling until golden and set.
Finishing Touches:
Cool pie completely on a wire rack to allow filling to firm up for clean slices. Serve slightly warm or at room temperature for best flavor.

note.label: You Must Know
note.content:
• Preheat oven properly and start baking at 450°F to set the crust quickly.
  • Avoid overbaking to prevent a dry or cracked filling.
  • The pie is ready when the filling is golden brown and slightly jiggly but not liquid.
  • Store leftovers covered at room temperature for up to 2 days or refrigerated for up to 4 days; reheat gently before serving.

structured_content.content: This pie has been a centerpiece at many family celebrations, evoking warmth and togetherness. Baking it always reminds me of joyful moments shared around the table with loved ones.

Enhance the pie by adding a pinch of cinnamon or a splash of bourbon to the filling for a warm, spicy twist. Toast pecans lightly before adding for extra crunch and depth. A sprinkle of flaky sea salt on top before baking can beautifully balance the sweetness.

Serve warm with a scoop of vanilla ice cream or a dollop of whipped cream. Pair with strong coffee or a sweet dessert wine for an indulgent finish. Perfect for holiday feasts, casual dinners, or afternoon tea.

For a gluten-free crust, substitute all-purpose flour with a gluten-free blend. Vegan versions can use plant-based butter and egg replacers, with maple syrup instead of corn syrup. Try mixing pecans with walnuts or adding chocolate chips for a unique twist.

note.label: Pro Tips
note.content:
• Use cold ingredients and minimal handling for a tender, flaky crust.
  • Whisk filling ingredients thoroughly to avoid lumps and ensure smooth texture.
  • Start baking at high heat to set the crust, then reduce to prevent burning.
  • Garnish with whole pecans arranged in a decorative pattern for an impressive look.

structured_content.content: With this recipe in your kitchen, you can confidently create a Southern classic that delights every time. Enjoy the process and savor the sweet rewards of your homemade pecan pie!
